title: Sarfaraz Khan being 'completely dumped' in Australia puzzles Sanjay Manjrekar: 'Let's not try and play God' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sarfaraz Khan being 'completely dumped' in Australia puzzles Sanjay Manjrekar: 'Let's not try and play God'

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar expresses confusion over Sarfaraz Khan's absence in the Indian squad during their Test series in Australia, despite his strong performance record in domestic cricket.

  • Sarfaraz Khan was included in the Indian squad for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy but did not play in any of the five Tests.
  • Manjrekar argues that Sarfaraz deserved an opportunity based on his record of three half-centuries and one century in 11 Test innings.
  • He criticized the decision to leave Sarfaraz out, suggesting it was unfair given his performance and potential impact in the Australian conditions.
"Let's not try and play God too much, maybe just watch a little bit... you've got to reward people who've got runs," said Manjrekar.

In conclusion, Manjrekar believes that giving Sarfaraz a chance could have provided valuable insights into his adaptability at the international level.
newTitle: Sanjay Manjrekar questions Sarfaraz Khan's omission from Australian Tests

  • Bumrah was named Player of the Series with 32 wickets.

  • India reportedly missed Mohammed Shami throughout the series.
  • Bumrah's reaction during the match against Sam Konstas displayed his competitive spirit.
  • Fleming credited Mohammed Siraj for his performance, but emphasized Shami's absence was felt.
  • India faced elimination from the World Test Championship finals after a series of defeats.
“Bumrah is a star and the greatest I have seen. Mohammed Siraj also bowled well, but I think they missed Mohammed Shami.” - Damien Fleming

title: Pakistan need to know what they want from Test cricket - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
Pakistan need to know what they want from Test cricket

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: ESPNcricinfo

The recent performances in both the Newlands Test and the Quaid-e-Azam Trophy final highlight Pakistan's struggles and inconsistencies in Test cricket. While the domestic final showcased thrilling moments, the national team's predicament raises questions about their cricketing strategy.

  • Pakistan capitulated for 194 in the Newlands Test, falling behind South Africa.
  • The Quaid-e-Azam Trophy saw Sialkot triumph over Peshawar in a one-wicket thriller.
  • Pakistan's busy home season saw limited clarity regarding the timing and format of domestic tournaments.
  • Shan Masood, the captain, emphasizes the need for a more consistent strategy moving forward.
  • Pakistan faces a prolonged gap with just two Tests scheduled in the next 14 months, affecting their World Test Championship standing.

The feast of the last six months will be followed by a prolonged famine; Pakistan do not play another Test until October, and just two in the next 14 months. It is something their captain Shan Masood has called on to change, but... Pakistan's approach to Test cricket has been so furiously inconsistent that even a glut of Tests is unlikely to lead to improved results.

As Pakistan reassesses its priorities in Test cricket, defining a clear direction is crucial to avoid recycling through failures and stunted potential.

"Not Acceptable": Yuvraj Singh Reminds India Of 'More Hurting' Loss Than Against Australia - NDTV Sports
summary:
"Not Acceptable": Yuvraj Singh Reminds India Of 'More Hurting' Loss Than Against Australia

Publication Date: Not provided
Source: Not provided

In a recent interview, Yuvraj Singh emphasized that India's home whitewash by New Zealand was a more significant defeat than their loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. He defended veterans Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, urging critics to recognize their past contributions.

  • Yuvraj highlights the significance of India’s 0-3 defeat against New Zealand at home.
  • He believes the series loss to Australia is more understandable due to their dominance historically.
  • Yuvraj criticized the harsh commentary towards Rohit and Kohli, calling for support instead of accusations.
  • He praised Rohit for selflessly stepping back from the final Test.
  • The former player supports the new coaching direction with Gautam Gambhir.

"According to me, losing (to) New Zealand is more hurting. Because they are losing 3-0 at home. You know, that is not acceptable."

Yuvraj concluded with a call for critic restraint, emphasizing the difficulty of supporting players during tough times.
newTitle: Yuvraj Singh Critiques India's Recent Test Losses, Stresses Support for Rohit and Kohli

summary:
Jasprit Bumrah nominated for ICC Player of the Month for second time in a row

Publication Date: Jan 07, 2025   Source: Hindustan Times

India's Jasprit Bumrah has been nominated for the ICC Player of the Month award for December 2024 following impressive performances in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia, taking 22 wickets across three Tests.

  • Bumrah was dominant with performances of 4/61, 6/76, and 9 wickets in the series.
  • This nomination marks his second consecutive nomination for the award.
  • He aims to also claim the Sir Garfield Sobers Trophy for ICC Men’s Cricketer of the Year.
  • Other nominees include Pat Cummins and Dane Paterson for their crucial roles in Australia and South Africa’s successes, respectively.
  • Smriti Mandhana is nominated for ICC Women’s Player of the Month with notable performances in December.
“Bumrah was the primary resisting force during the series as Australia grew in confidence.”

This nomination emphasizes Bumrah’s impact on the game and continues to highlight his elite status in cricket.
newTitle: Jasprit Bumrah nominated for ICC Player of the Month for second time in a row

title: Update on HBL PSL Player Draft - PCB
summary:
Update on HBL PSL Player Draft Rescheduled

Date: 7 January 2025 | Source: Pakistan Cricket Board

Venue: Huzoori Bagh, Lahore Fort

The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has confirmed that the HBL PSL Player Draft has been rescheduled to take place on 13 January at Huzoori Bagh, Lahore Fort, due to unforeseen logistical challenges.

  • The official hashtag for the HBL PSL Players Draft is #DECADEOFHBLPSL.
  • The event has been moved from Gwadar to Lahore.
  • The HBL PSL 2025 Trophy Tour will include Gwadar in its route across Pakistan.
  • The Player Draft ceremony will occur at a historic venue.
  • The PSL's 10th edition is scheduled from 8 April to 19 May 2025.
“The six franchises will assemble their star-studded squads on Monday, 13 January during the Player Draft ceremony.”

This rescheduling highlights the PCB's commitment to conducting a successful draft at a historically significant location.
newTitle: Update on HBL PSL Player Draft Rescheduled

OFFICIAL! FC Barcelona secures the registration of Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor - FC Barcelona Noticias
summary:
OFFICIAL! FC Barcelona secures the registration of Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor

Published on: October 2023

Source: FC Barcelona Noticias

After much speculation, FC Barcelona has successfully registered players Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor in LaLiga, with the approval of LaLiga and the RFEF after a financial strategy involving VIP seat sales.

  • The sale of VIP seats at Spotify Camp Nou brought in approximately 100-120 million euros.
  • The league had previously rejected an agreement due to insufficient guarantees.
  • Article 130.2 allowed exceptional registrations despite the deadline.
  • The loss of Dani Olmo could have resulted in losses exceeding 250 million euros for Barcelona.
“The only option FC Barcelona had to register the two players was to cling to the current regulations based on article 130.2 of the regulations justifying a case of 'force majeure.'”

Ultimately, FC Barcelona was able to secure the registration of both players, avoiding significant financial repercussions.
newTitle: FC Barcelona Successfully Registers Dani Olmo and Pau Víctor

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal Deserves Champions Trophy Spot, But Not at Shubman Gill’s Expense - cricxtasy.com
Stress fracture to surgery! How injuries hurt Jasprit Bumrah’s career since 2018 - The Times of India
summary:
Stress fracture to surgery! How injuries hurt Jasprit Bumrah’s career since 2018

Publication Date: Not provided | Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, India’s leading fast bowler, has faced numerous injuries that have significantly hindered his cricket career from 2018 onward, highlighting his extraordinary resilience.

  • Bumrah fractured his left thumb in 2018, affecting his performance during the tour of Ireland and England.
  • A lower-back stress fracture in 2019 kept him out for three months.
  • In January 2021, he suffered an abdominal strain that led to missing a crucial Test in Australia.
  • Recurring back issues in 2022 resulted in missing both the Asia Cup and T20 World Cup.
  • Bumrah underwent back surgery in early 2023, which prevented him from participating in major tournaments like IPL 2023.
  • He made a comeback in August 2023 and played a vital role in India’s successful campaigns in the Asia Cup and ODI World Cup.
“His ability to bounce back from potentially career-ending injuries demonstrates his remarkable strength of character and unwavering commitment to the sport.”

In conclusion, Jasprit Bumrah's journey through injuries reflects not just individual struggles but also the impact on the team's performance. His health remains crucial as India heads into future tournaments.
newTitle: Injuries Impacting Jasprit Bumrah’s Career since 2018

title: Rohit Sharma "Was Waiting For India's Escape Route To...": Report's Startling Claims - NDTV Sports
'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal - The Times of India
summary:
'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal

Publication Date & Source: October 2023, Times of India

The article discusses the on-field exchange between Australian cricketer Sam Konstas and Indian captain Jasprit Bumrah during the fifth Test match, where Konstas acknowledges provoking Bumrah leading to the dismissal of Usman Khawaja.

  • Konstas addressed the incident, explaining it stemmed from Bumrah's frustration with Khawaja's delay.
  • He stated, “Oh, I didn't get too fazed. Unfortunately, Uzi got out. It was probably my fault, but it happens. It's cricket.”
  • Despite the tension, Konstas praised Bumrah's performance and acknowledged the overall strength of the team.
  • Konstas reflected on his calm demeanor during his Test debut and the support from family and teammates.
  • His performance has raised expectations for potential inclusion in the upcoming Sri Lanka tour.
“But obviously, it was a packed stadium, and Uzi (Khawaja) said my adrenaline was pumped when I was batting, but I didn't feel that.”

In conclusion, Konstas's remarks highlight the competitive spirit of cricket and the importance of maintaining composure under pressure, as well as the promising future for his career.
newTitle: 'My fault': Sam Konstas admits provoking Jasprit Bumrah, leading to Usman Khawaja’s dismissal
